attributes.action: Stop the proposal of closing public toilets by the Wirral council
attributes.additional_details: It’s a basic human right. Freedom. People like me who need these toilets just to be able to get a bit of freedom. By closing these I cannot go out and get the freedom that we fought for.
attributes.background: Public toilets are a necessity for people that have bladder issues. Wirral council are proposing to close these to save public funding. However by closing these your deny people with bladder issues a basic right of freedom. People like me who rely heavily on these.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Wirral council also have their own petitions system, you can find out more here: https://www.wirral.gov.uk/about-council/have-your-say/petitions
